docs.title: Explore My Work
docs.text:
I build audit-ready safety and quality data systems.

View Case Study Download One-Pager

docs.title: Functional Safety × Data Governance Portfolio
docs.text:
I help engineering organizations turn safety and quality evidence into audit-ready, decision-ready data systems.

My focus is at the intersection of:

  • Functional Safety (ISO 26262 mindset, traceability, risk control)
  • Data Governance (definitions, ownership, controls, quality rules)
  • Analytics Execution (SQL-driven metrics, release gates, actionable dashboards)

docs.title: What I Solve
docs.text:
Many teams already have tools (ALM, test management, defect tracking), but still struggle with:

  • Inconsistent KPI definitions across teams
  • Broken links between requirements, tests, and defects
  • Manual, error-prone release reporting
  • High audit preparation effort

I design and implement governance-driven analytics that make these processes reproducible and trustworthy.

docs.title: Core Value I Deliver
docs.text:
• Unified metric definitions for safety/quality KPIs
  • Data quality controls (completeness, consistency, referential integrity)
  • Traceability coverage and gap detection
  • Automated release-gate logic with clear pass/fail reasons
  • Audit-ready lineage, documentation, and change traceability

docs.title: Case Study 1 — Safety Traceability & Release Gate Governance
docs.text:
Built a governance-based data model linking requirements, tests, and defects, with automated quality checks and release gate evaluation.

Read Case Study 1

docs.title: Case Study 2 — Audit Readiness Through Data Controls
docs.text:
Designed standardized definitions and ownership workflows to reduce audit friction and reporting inconsistency.

Read Case Study 2

docs.title: Case Study 1: Safety Traceability & Release Gate Governance
1) Context
docs.text:
An engineering organization managed safety-relevant data across multiple systems (requirements, test management, and defect tracking). Although tools were in place, cross-system consistency and traceability were weak.

Domain: [Automotive / Rail / Industrial] Scope: [Program / Product Line / ECU / Platform] Period: [Month YYYY – Month YYYY]

docs.title: 2) Problem
docs.text:
The team faced recurring issues:

  • KPI definitions differed across teams
  • Requirement–test–defect links were incomplete
  • Manual release reporting consumed significant effort
  • Audit preparation required extensive ad-hoc reconciliation

docs.title: Initial Baseline (before intervention)
docs.text:
• Traceability coverage: [X%]
  • Unlinked high-criticality items: [X]
  • Manual reporting effort per cycle: [X hours/days]
  • Audit preparation lead time: [X days]

docs.title: 3) Objective
docs.text:
Create a governance-driven analytics layer to deliver:

  1. Standardized KPI definitions
  2. Data quality controls and ownership
  3. Traceability gap visibility
  4. Automated release-gate status with explicit pass/fail criteria

docs.title: A. Governance Design
docs.text:
• Defined critical data elements (CDEs): requirements, tests, defects, trace links
  • Established role model:
  • Data Owner: [Role]
  • Data Steward: [Role]
  • Data Custodian: [Role]
  • Published KPI dictionary and data glossary

docs.title: B. Data Modeling & Metrics
docs.text:
• Built layered model (staging → intermediate → marts)
  • Standardized metric logic for:
  • Traceability coverage
  • Pass rate by build/version
  • Severity-based open defect counts
  • MTTR and reopen rate

docs.title: C. Data Quality Controls
docs.text:
Implemented rule checks such as:

  • Unique and non-null key constraints
  • Referential integrity across requirement/test/defect entities
  • Valid enum values for severity/status
  • Business-rule checks (e.g., closed high-severity defects require root cause)

docs.title: D. Release Gate Logic
docs.text:
Created automated gate criteria with explicit thresholds:

  • Safety traceability coverage ≥ [X%]
  • Open Sev1 defects = 0
  • Open Sev2 defects ≤ [X]
  • Build pass rate ≥ [X%]

Produced final gate output:

  • PASS / FAIL
  • Failed checks and root reasons
  • KPI snapshot for decision meeting

docs.title: Quantitative Impact
docs.text:
• Traceability coverage improved from [X%] → [Y%]
  • Unlinked critical items reduced from [X] → [Y]
  • Reporting effort reduced from [X hours/days] → [Y]
  • Audit preparation lead time reduced from [X days] → [Y]

docs.title: Qualitative Impact
docs.text:
• Teams aligned on shared KPI definitions
  • Release decisions became faster and evidence-based
  • Audit discussions shifted from “data disputes” to “risk decisions”

docs.title: 6) Deliverables
docs.text:
• KPI dictionary and governance definitions
  • Quality rule catalog with check outcomes
  • Traceability gap report
  • Release gate summary table
  • Documentation and lineage views for audit traceability

docs.title: 7) Key Lessons
docs.text:
1. Governance must start with a narrow, high-value scope (CDE-first)
  2. Ownership clarity is as important as technical controls
  3. Automated quality checks prevent recurring manual firefighting

docs.title: 8) Tools & Methods
docs.text:
• SQL
  • [dbt / Data modeling framework]
  • [BI/reporting tool]
  • Governance framework: Owner / Steward / Custodian model
  • Standards mindset: traceability, control evidence, reproducibility

docs.title: 9) What I Would Improve Next
docs.text:
• Add SLA-driven issue workflows with automatic ticketing
  • Expand lineage and impact analysis depth
  • Integrate upstream APIs for near real-time data refresh
